revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of August 29, 1886, at Carriacou
tldr: The author reports on the observations of the total solar eclipse of August 29, 1886, made at Carriacou. They discuss the coronal pictures, spectroscopic cameras, and the search for carbon bands during totality. The observations suggest that the absorption producing the Fraunhofer lines may occur in successive layers of the solar atmosphere.
